channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Engineers under pressure over wage cuts, job security
item.description: Consulting engineers say some government agencies are insisting that if firms cut staff pay to survive, they pass these cuts on as a cost saving on public projects.

item.title: Families of Chinese New Zealanders stuck in Fiji for months
item.description: Dozens of Chinese nationals with family connections to New Zealand have been stuck in Fiji due to Covid-19 border closures.

item.title: International marine expert claims she was ignored over advice on saving dolphins
item.description: A international marine expert who reviewed a plan to save Māui and Hectors dolphin's says she tried to help and claims she was ignored.

item.title: Cash injection brings relief but anxiety over longterm funding remains
item.description: An injection of money into cash-strapped community health care services is expected to cover most of the immediate extra costs from Covid-19 but anxiety over long-term funding remains.

item.title: 'We're stuck': Frustration as stranded family endures life in a shed
item.description: A school principal says his students, locked out of the country by border closures, are trying their best to keep up with their schoolwork - despite living in a shed in South Africa.

item.title: In other news ... what we missed during the Covid-19 lockdown
item.description: The Detail - The world didn't completely stop while we were in lockdown. Here's a summary of what else happened.

item.title: Study finds young adults slipping through gaps for rheumatic fever treatment
item.description: Senior clinicians are calling for a national register of people with rheumatic fever, to help protect younger people missing out on vital treatment.

item.title: Could a Covid-free NZ be the answer to film industry's prayers?
item.description: A leading Australian screen industry figure says New Zealand's Covid-free status gives it a huge advantage when it comes to enticing high-value overseas film and TV productions.

item.title: Thousands of NZers march for Black Lives Matter
item.description: Thousands of New Zealanders have marched at Black Lives Matter rallies in Auckland, Wellington and Dunedin.

item.title: Taonga degrading in leaky Canterbury Museum - director
item.description: There is a "dire and urgent" need to redevelop the Canterbury museum, which could be funded as a 'shovel-ready' project to help stimulate the economy, its director says.

item.title: ‘It’s unsafe out here for us’: Trans communities in solidarity with BLM
item.description: As the murders of Black trans people in the US continue to lack widespread media attention, trans communities in New Zealand march in solidarity with Black Lives Matter, despite the safety risk to themselves.

item.title: Police hunt for intruders after home invasion and aggravated burglary
item.description: Wairarapa police are trying to identify four people after a "terrifying" aggravated burglary at a resident's home.

item.title: Lengthy waits for driver testing due to Covid-19
item.description: The New Zealand Transport Agency says social distancing rules during the Covid-19 lockdown stopped driver testing from happening, causing a backlog.

item.title: Most parents worried about children at school after lockdown - survey
item.description: Parents of school-aged children were very worried that they could catch Covid-19 if schools were reopened at alert level 3, new research has found.

item.title: Covid-19: Twenty-three days without a new case in New Zealand
item.description: New Zealand has now gone 23 days without a new case of Covid-19.

item.title: Whio enjoy population boom in Egmont National Park
item.description: A five-yearly census has revealed Egmont National Park is experiencing a whio population boom.

item.title: National MP Chris Penk's book derides government's Covid-19 response
item.description: National backbench MP Chris Penk has released a book criticising the government's "lockdown lunacy" as "incompetent", a position that would seem at odds with that of his party's leadership.

item.title: 'No way' Oranga Tamariki allowed to take babies from hospital - Waitematā DHB
item.description: A Māori trust and a senior health board member claim they have stopped Oranga Tamariki taking children into state care at Waitākere Hospital this morning.
